name: Hyatt Regency Sarasota

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights on our first visit to Florida and i was not disappointed in any way. I work in the travel industry and sometimes drive my partner mad with my constant busman's holiday about service but on this occassion have nothing negative to say !!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, Excellent Staff and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived late as our flight was delayed 4 hours and the staff were warm and welcoming and when we advised it was out first time in Florida they gave us so much help and moved us to a room with a better view. All of the staff i met in the hotel was professional, pleasant and very helpful, Gigi who worked in the restaurant was fantastic. The food was excellent and priced very well. The pool was lovely and showed a film which was a great feature and so were the waterfalls.
reviews.title: Great Weekend Stay

likes.liked: — The amazing staff, room, and view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel decor was fresh, clean and looked fantastic - overall a wonderful stay in a wonderful location. We were there for relaxation and we got it. The room was a reasonable size with a balcony view and it was cleaned and turned down each day. We self parked each day and walked down to the end of the road to the water and admired the view from there. Shops etc were all within a few minutes of the hotel by car.
reviews.title: Delightful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: I would have no hesitatation to recommend this hotel to those looking for a peaceful, restful or romatic break.
reviews.title: Nice stay, nice place....

likes.liked: — We got a great room rate through hotwire; clean, renovations are really nice; location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a couple of nights at the property this past weekend. Valet staff were friendly, polite and knowledgeable. Front Desk staff were always smiling and professional. The hotel is very pretty with clean lines and bright colors. The pool was a bit busy, but was nice to lounge and hear the waterfall feature. On saturday night, they had a movie projected over one end of the pool which was quite interesting. The views from the balcony were absolutely gorgeous. One of the best little weekend vacations i've had in a long while. I definitely recommend this place to everyone. The only minor thing would be their turn down service. They never really "turned - down" the bed, they just rearranged the pillows. Other than that, it was a great stay.
reviews.title: Such a pleasant stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel looks nice and has some really nice features. But overall, the place isn't that nice.
reviews.title: So much potential...but not a nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest problem is the noise. I had 2 seperate rooms, and both rooms constantly sounded like people were dragging furniture. I couldn't really figure it out, but I needed earplugs.
reviews.title: Great Location, views and pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other problem with the place is how they nickel and dime you. No free computers for guests to use - you have to pay $1/minute, or pay $10/day for in-room internet. A mini-fridge costs $5.
reviews.title: Interesting!?

likes.liked: — The new furnishings and the balconies
likes.disliked: — Unable to fix ac and no spare rooms to allow for problems. They has

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to a conference there, and the food service was lousy. Most places provide some snacks and soda in the afternoon, but they didn't. Also, there's usually some breakfast food available, and all they had was some coffee.
reviews.title: Great modern design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: On the positive, you're right by the beach and the pool is great. The pool is happening and looks really nice and arranged well. The rooms are huge and the TV is a sweet flat panel.
reviews.title: Bring your nickels and dimes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a Hyatt Goldpassport member, and always look forward to staying at one of their properties. This was our first visit to the Hyatt Regency Sarasota in Sarasota, FL.
reviews.title: Left This Hotel Feeling Disappointed

likes.disliked: — The room and the breakfast buffet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'll start with the positives: The front desk personnel were very good: friendly, helpful and efficient. The (inside) bartenders were terrific as were the doormen.
reviews.title: Good and just ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel recently went through a renovation, and it is bright and cheery, but it looked and felt like a Hyatt Place. There were some small things that bothered me, but also some major things:
reviews.title: Eye Candy!

likes.liked: — Killer bed and free self parking
likes.disliked: — No omelet station at breakfast buffet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is was no mirror in the bedroom part of the guest room (I've never stayed at a Hyatt without a bedroom mirror). Wall hooks might be something the hotel could add because the closet is small for two people. Plus there was only one luggage rack for a double room - one suitcase ended up on the floor. The only mirror was above the bathroom sink. Also, I'm not a big fan of the sink being outside of the bath/shower/toilet area.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Now, as for the bathroom itself - it was so small and set up awkwardly. It had a useless, drippy "rain shower" overhead, an extremely hard to operate tub handle/faucet. You needed the strength of a gorilla to turn it. The sink was slow draining. No backup toilet tissue rolls.
reviews.title: CAN'T GET MUCH BETTER THAN THIS!

likes.disliked: — Sometimes Staff was overwhelmed with work, slow at getting orders, drinks, but rarely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Just been refurbished – amazing job – clean – comfortable and a hotel room that you really won’t want to leave. Would certainly visit again if in the area
reviews.title: Great new refurb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel is in the middle of a major revamp. Be advised that they are not done yet, so there is some construction going on in the hotel as of this writing. I recommend calling first about this. They also seem to cater to wedding parties, so you might encounter gaggles of drunken twenty-somethings in evening gowns and tuxes staggering around the place from time to time.
reviews.title: Construction noise is a problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The quality of the staff varied greatly from extremely personable to downright testy. The restaurant appeared to be seriously understaffed, although Sheila, the woman who served us dinner, was very good. The menu at the restaurant was limited, but the burgers (both the Hamburger and the Portobello Burger) were excellent. Others reported that the Entrees were merely adequate, but I can't speak to that. I did notice that, for a place on the Gulf of Mexico, the choices for seafood entrees were surprisingly weak (which is why I ended up eating the burger). It didn't appear that any of the fish on the menu was caught locally. The breakfast buffet is adequate, but nothing special. One breakfast specialty is the Sticky Bun French Toast, which was good, but certainly not a good choice for the health-conscious.
reviews.title: Beautiful Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't sunbathe, so I can't report on the pool, but it seemed popular, so maybe this is a good hotel for sun worshippers. There is a pier in back of the hotel and you can board yacht tours directly there.
reviews.title: just terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Pro: The rooms are very nice, and the staff does a good job keeping it clean. The area around the hotel is quite beautiful, and there are even a few interesting things within walking distance. Directly across the street is the G. Wiz science center, which is a perfect place to take kids.
reviews.title: Hyatt was great!

likes.liked: — very clean, friendly staff, great pool
likes.disliked: — no internet connection in rooms and only one computer in lobby to check email

description: Situated in a beautiful resort like setting with our own private marina on Sarasota Bay, Hyatt Regency Sarasota is 3 miles from the Sarasota/Bradenton airport and minutes from white sand beaches and the premier theaters, restaurants, museums and attractions of Florida's cultural coast. Hyatt Regency Sarasota's oasis of lush gardens, sparkling blue water and relaxed elegance combines with the year-round temperate climate of Sarasota Bay to set the ideal backdrop for a perfect meeting destination in a beautiful resort-like setting. Once inside the viibrant "new" rooms you'll discover why our unique blend of business and pleasure come together as you experience our elegant design theme enhanced views of Sarasota Bay and its natural beauty. The Hyatt Regency Sarasota has completed a 22 million dollar transformation where guests will enjoy newly appointed guestrooms, lobbys and restaurants.
